data.name: Systems and Assembly
data.info: Architecture is a living system too complex to be explained by isolated variables and definitive causal relationships. However, these designers remain undaunted in their investigation and deconstruction of architectureâ€™s underlying mechanisms. Interested in more than just the formal and aesthetic language of the profession, they approach architecture meticulously and methodologically with the belief that design can be rationalized. They actively study and tinker with materials, computational operations, and fabrication techniques, in hopes of gaining full clarity of the layers that make an architecture what it is. Iteration after iteration, they push the boundaries of architecture and seek to optimize or even perfect these systems and tools to reimagine and reshape the built environment.

about.title: Gradshow 2021
about.content: This year, the NEXT STOP celebrates the unique journeys of every undergraduate student of ASD class of 2021. The challenges that every student faced strongly reflects in their design ethos and style that propagates through this exhibit. Through the five categories that connects the plethora of ideas from all individuals, the exhibit will demonstrate the versatility of all students who embarked this journey of self-discovery; where we are now and where we could be heading next.
